fullDescription.intro:
Extracts relations triplets contained in sentences of a document by investigating relations of tagged named-entities. The node needs part-of-speech and named-entity tagged documents. Additionally, there has to be a second document column containing lemmatized documents, meaning that all words are converted to their canonical form, dictionary form or citation form.
However, this node can also be used with plain documents by using the Apply preprocessing option. If this option is selected, part-of-speech tagging, named-entity tagging and lemmatizing will be done by this node. The Stanford CoreNLP default settings are used in this case. These task will be applied internally and will not affect the documents in the document column. Extracting tags and lemmas produced by checking this option is not possible.
The node creates four new columns: two object columns containing named-entities, a relation type column and a confidence column. Currently, the node only handles classic named-entities like PERSON, LOCATION and ORGANIZATION.
Relation types that can be extracted are Live_In, OrgBased_In, Located_In, Work_For and _NR for no relation between two entities.
The confidence refers to the relation type with the highest probability of these five classes.
Note: Relation Extraction is a computationally expensive operation. For the usage of this node it is recommended to run KNIME with at least 2GB of heap space. To increase the heap space, change the -Xmx setting in the knime.ini file.
This node is based on Stanford CoreNLP 3.9.1.
For more information about StanfordNLP and Relation Extraction, click here.
fullDescription.option:
The document column to use.
Note: If the Apply preprocessing option is unchecked, the documents have to be tagged by a part-of-speech tagger and a named-entity tagger (optionally).
The document column containing the lemmatized documents.
If checked, part-of-speech tagging, named-entity tagging and lemmatizing will be done by this node.
The number of threads to use.

ports.inPort: The input table which contains the documents and lemmatized documents (if needed).
ports.outPort: The output table which contains data from the input table, extracted relations and a relation confidence.
